title: Fred Meyer (American football)
text: Frederic D. Meyer (September 29, 1919 – July 10, 1996) was an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="End%20%28gridiron%20football%29">end</a> who played in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) for the <a href="Philadelphia%20Eagles">Philadelphia Eagles</a> in <a href="1942%20NFL%20season">1942</a> and <a href="1945%20NFL%20season">1945</a>. After playing <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for <a href="Stanford%20Cardinal%20football">Stanford</a>, he was drafted by the Eagles in the 12th round (103rd overall) of the <a href="1942%20NFL%20Draft">1942 NFL Draft</a>. During the 1942 season, he ranked among the NFL's leaders with 324 receiving yards (sixth) and 32.4 receiving yards per game (fifth). He served in <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> for the <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> before rejoining the Eagles in 1945.
